description: Beginning September 3rd 2013, the Office of Admissions will be open Monday - Friday 9:00am - 5:00 pm. The office is closed on federal holidays and weekends. Following our school calendar, engineering tours are offered in the FALL semester from late September- November, the SPRING semester from January- April and the SUMMER starting in June.

related.description: 27-year-old will support teammate Valverde After two seasons away from the Tour de France, Beñat Intxausti ( Movistar) will switch his season's focus back to the Tour for 2014. The Movistar rider will be there for experience and to ride in assistance of Alejandro Valverde, who is looking for his first Tour podium, according to Biciciclismo.
related.title: Intxausti To Ride 2014 Tour De France | Cyclingnews.com

related.description: Pinot and co. compensate for Tour with strong Vuelta showing FDJ.fr 2013 WorldTour ranking: 17th Win count: 33 Top riders: Thibaut Pinot (33rd), Matthieu Ladagnous (67th), Arthur Vichot (76th) Grade: C+. The team had a fine Vuelta a España, which almost lifted the squad to a B grade, but that was countered by a disappointing Tour de France.
related.title: 2013 Report Card: FDJ.fr

related.description: As 2013 draws to a close, our cycling blogger takes a look back at all the main stories from the past 12 months. In part one, Blazin' Saddles looks at January through to June. January: "Yes. Yes. Yes. Yes. Yes!" No, 2013 didn't begin with a screening of When Harry Met Sally.
related.title: Cycling review of the year 2013: Part One

title: Engineering Tour Calendar
content:
Beginning September 3rd 2013, the Office of Admissions will be open Monday - Friday 9:00am - 5:00 pm. The office is closed on federal holidays and weekends.

Following our school calendar, engineering tours are offered in the FALL semester from late September- November, the SPRING semester from January- April and the SUMMER starting in June. Please keep this in mind as your plan your visit.

View tour dates and times and register for a tour here.

All tours begin at the Office of Admissions located at 30 Cooper Square, 3rd floor. All tours begin with a brief overview of Cooper followed by a student-guided tour which lasts approximately 1 ½ hours. Please note that tours are limited to 15 students. If you require any special accommodations, please make a note when you register. To register for one of the dates below, e-mail admissions@cooper.edu with the subject line "School of Engineering Tour" and provide the first choice date, name of the student, contact phone number and the number of people who will be joining the student. You are not confirmed until you receive a confirmation email from us. If you need to cancel a tour reservation, please call us at 212.353.4120.

We look forward to meeting you!

If you have additional questions about Cooper Union, please email admissions@cooper.edu
